授業目的: Building on Reading IIA, this course aims to improve English reading skills and build vocabulary knowledge. In intensive reading, students will read nonfiction articles with a focus on improving both general understanding and specific reading skills. The course will also provide other reading opportunities, including readings aimed at improving reading fluency without the aid of dictionaries (“extended readings”) and readings to extend reading skills and knowledge of previously studied materials.
到達目標:
At the end of the semester, students should be able to:

use specific reading skills and general comprehension to understand readings,

read more fluently,

understand vocabulary frequently used for nonfiction articles.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.

トピック.授業計画1:
Intensive readings with the textbook (30%)

Class is generally open from 9 a.m. on the day of the class. If the class is not available—and if there is no explanation—please mail me as soon as possible. This grade also includes reflective writing on your learning.

2. Assessment of the Intensive readings with the textbook (30%)

Details will be posted on LUNA.

Vocabulary (20%)

You will take vocabulary quizzes twice in the semester. The focus is on the units just studied. However, some questions from previous units will also appear. See LUNA for more details.

4. Extended readings (20%)

As in the previous semester, you will be using Mreader to show you have read 30,000 words or more using books from the library. You will also be writing short book reports and comparing them with colleagues. The details will be given on LUNA.

This is subject to change. Check LUNA frequently.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students are expected to continue their readings outside the class.
